Dragonborn.Description: Shaped by draconic gods or the dragons themselves, dragonborn combine the best attributes of dragons and humanoids.

Mountain Dwarf.Description: Mountain Dwarves are short, strong, and accustomed to a difficult life in rugged terrain.

Tools: Artisan's tools of your choice: smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools

Hill Dwarf.Description: Hill Dwarves have keen senses, deep intuition, and remarkable resilience.

Tools: Artisan's tools of your choice: smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools

High Elf.Description: High Elves have a keen mind and a mastery of magic

Wood Elf.Description: Wood Elves have keen senses and intuition, and move quickly and stealthily through forests.

Dark Elf.Description: Dark Elves were banished from the surface world for following the goddess Lolth down the path to evil and corruption.

Rock Gnome.Description: Rock Gnomes have a natural inventiveness and hardiness beyond that of other gnomes

Forest Gnome.Description: Forset Gnomes have a natural knack for illusion and inherent quickness and stealth

Half-Elf.Description: Half Elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their Elf and Human parents

Half-Orc.Description: Half-orcs are not evil by nature, but evil does lurk within them, whether they embrace it or rebel against it.

Lightfoot Halfling.Description: Lightfoot Halflings can easily hide from notice, even using other people as cover

Stout Halfling.Description: Stout Halflings are hardier than average and have some resistance to poison.

Human.Description: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races.

Tiefling.Description: Tieflings were once humans, who had the essence of Asmodeus infused into their bloodline

Barbarian.Description: A fierce warrior of primitive background who can enter a battle rage.

Skills: Any two from Animal Handling, Athletics, Intimidation, Nature, Perception, Survival

Equipment: (a) a greataxe or (b) any martial melee weapon
(a) two handaxes or (b) any simple weapon

Bard.Description: Bard weave magic through words and music.

Tools: Three musical instruments of your choice

Equipment: (a) a rapier, (b) a longsword, or (c) any simple weapon
(a) a diplomat's pack or (b) an entertainer's pack
(a) a lute or (b) any other musical instrument

Cleric.Description: A priestly champion who wields divine magic in service of a higher power.

Skills: Choose two from History, lnsight, Medicine, Persuasion, and Religion

Equipment: (a) a mace or (b) a warhammer (if proficient)
(a) scale mail, (b) leather armor, or (c) chain mail (if proficient)
(a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a priest's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

Druid.Description: A priest of the Old Faith, wielding the powers of nature and adopting animal forms.

Armor: shields (druids will not wear armor or use shields made of metal)
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Animal Handling, Insight, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Religion, and Survival

Equipment: a) a wooden shield or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a scimitar or (b) any simple melee weapon

Fighter.Description: A master of martial combal, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.

Skills: Choose two skills from Acrobatics, Animal Handling, Athletics, History, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, and Survival

Equipment: (a) chain mail or (b) leather, longbow, and 20 arrows
(a) a martial weapon and a shield or (b) two martial weapons
(a) a Iight crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) two handaxes
(a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

Monk.Description: An master of martial arts, harnessing the power of the body in pursuit of physical and spiritual perfection.

Tools: Choose one type of artisan's tools or one musical instrument
Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Athletics, History, Insight, Religion, and Stealth

Equipment: (a) a shortsword or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

Special Rules: Tongue of the Sun and Moon

Paladin.Description: Paladins swear to uphold justice and righteousness, and stand against the forces of evil.

Skills: Choose two from Athletics, Insight, Intimidation, Medicine, Persuasion, and Religion

Equipment: (a) a martial weapon and a shield or (b) two martial weapons
(a) five javelins or (b) any simple melee weapon
(a) a priest's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

Ranger.Description: Rangers specialize in hunting the monsters that threaten the edges of civilization.

Skills: Choose three from Animal Handling, Athletics, Insight, Investigation, Nature, Perception, Stealth, and Survival

Equipment: (a) two shortswords or (b) two simple melee weapons
(a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

Rogue.Description: Rogues rely on skill, stealth, and their foes' vulnerabilities to gain the upper hand

Skills: Choose four from Acrobatics, Athletics, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Performance, Persuasion. Sleight of Hand, and Stealth

Equipment: (a) a shortbow and quiver of 20 arrows or (b) a shortsword
(a) a burglar's pack, (b) a dungeoneer's pack, or (c) an explorer's pack

Sorceror.Description: A spellcaster who draws on inherent magic from a gift or bloodline.

Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Persuasion, and Religion

Equipment: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

Warlock.Description: A wielder of magic that is derived from a bargain with an extraplanar entity.

Skills: Choose two skills from Arcana, Deception, History, Intimidation, Investigation, Nature, and Religion

Equipment: (a) a lighl crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a scholar's pack or (b) a dungeoneer's pack
Leather armor, any simple weapon, and two daggers

Wizard.Description: A scholarly magic-user capable of manipulating the structures of reality.

Skills: Choose two from Arcana, History, Investigation, Medicine, Insight, and Religion

Equipment: (a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a scholar's pack or (b) an explorer's pack

Acolyte.Description: You have spent your life in the service of a temple to a specific god or pantheon of gods.
Equipment: A holy symbol (a gift to you when you entered the priesthood)
a prayer book or prayer wheel

Charlatan.Description: You can read people like an open book, and use this to your advantage.
Equipment: tools of the con of your choice

Criminal.Description: You are an experienced criminal wilh a history of breaking the law
Equipment: a set of dark common clothes including a hood

Entertainer.Description: You thrive in front of an audience, and your art is your life.
Equipment: the favor of an admirer (love letter, lock of hair, or trinket)

Folk Hero.Description: You come from a humble social rank, but you are destined for so much more.
Equipment: A set of artisan's tools (one of your choice)

Guild Artisan.Description: You are a member of an artisan's guild, skilled in a particular field.
Equipment: A set of artisan's tools (one of your choice)
a letter of introduction from your guild

Hermit.Description: You lived in seclusion for a formative part of your life.
Equipment: A scroll case stuffed full of notes fram your studies or prayers

Noble.Description: You understand wealth, power, and privilege, and carry a noble title.

Outlander.Description: You grew up in lhe wilds, far from civilization and the comforts of town and technology.
Equipment: a trophy from an animal you killed

Sage.Description: You spent years learning the lore of the multiverse, and mastered your field of study.
Equipment: a letter from a dead colleague posing a question you have not yet been able to answer
and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

Sailor.Description: You sailed on a seagoing vessel for years, facing down storms, monsters, and enemies.
Equipment: a lucky charm such as a rabbit foot or a small stone
and a belt pouch containing 10 gp

Soldier.Description: War has been your life for as long as you care to remember.
Equipment: a trophy taken from a fallen enemy
a set of bone dice or deck of cards

Urchin.Description: You grew up on the streets alone, orphaned, and poor.
Equipment: a map of the city you grew up in
a token to remember your parents by
